Title.evidence: Carotid Revascularization and Medical Management for Asymptomatic Carotid Stenosis Trial (CREST-2): A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: CREST-2 consists of two randomised trials.

Intervention.evidence: This analysis details the credentialing process for carotid artery stenting (CAS) interventionists.

Objective.evidence: The CREST-2 trial investigates the efficacy of carotid revascularization combined with intensive medical management (IMM) in patients with asymptomatic high-grade atherosclerotic stenosis.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomisation and allocation concealment methods not specified

Result_Outcome.evidence: The case rate was significantly associated with initial approval (P < .00001).

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported during the credentialing process.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial registration number and funding source were not provided in the manuscript.

Funding.evidence: The trial registration number and funding source were not provided in the manuscript.
